Overview.ExamName: National Eligibility cum Entrance Test - UG (NEET)

NotificationPhase.title: Notification & Application Start
NotificationPhase.description: Official NEET 2026 notification will be released by NTA along with the information bulletin, containing detailed instructions, eligibility criteria, syllabus, exam pattern, and application procedure. The online application portal opens simultaneously.

ApplicationPhase.title: NEET 2026 Application Process
ApplicationPhase.description: Includes filling personal and academic details, selecting exam centers and languages, uploading scanned documents (photograph, signature), and paying application fees through net banking, debit/credit cards, UPI, or online wallets.

CorrectionPhase.title: Application Correction Window
CorrectionPhase.description: NTA opens correction window to allow candidates to rectify errors in application form such as spelling mistakes, category changes, exam city preferences, and document uploads. No change in subjects or exam mode can be made.

CityIntimationPhase.title: City Intimation Slip Release
CityIntimationPhase.description: Candidates receive intimation slips with details about their allocated exam center city. This helps candidates make travel and accommodation arrangements well before the exam.

AdmitCardPhase.title: Admit Card Release
AdmitCardPhase.description: Admit cards (hall tickets) for NEET 2026 will be available online to download. Includes essential details like exam date, time, centre address, candidate's photograph, signature, and instructions. Must carry printed admit card and valid photo ID.

ExamPhase.title: NEET 2026 Exam Date
ExamPhase.description: Exam conducted as offline pen-and-paper test across the country and international centers. Duration: 3 hours (2:00 PM to 5:00 PM IST). Strict adherence to exam day guidelines, dress code, and banned items policy mandatory.

AnswerKeyPhase.title: Provisional Answer Key Release & Objection Submission
AnswerKeyPhase.description: NTA releases provisional answer key for candidates to review. Candidates can raise objections or challenge answers within limited time frame by paying nominal fee per question challenged. Ensures transparency and fairness in evaluation.

ResultPhase.title: Result Declaration & Final Answer Key
ResultPhase.date: Second or Third week of June 2026
ResultPhase.description: Results declared on official NTA NEET website. Final answer key incorporating corrections from objections published along with result. Candidates can view scores, ranks, percentiles, and qualifying status.

CounsellingPhase.title: Counselling Process
CounsellingPhase.description: Medical Counselling Committee (MCC) conducts centralized counselling for 15% All India Quota (AIQ) seats. State authorities hold counselling for 85% state quota seats. Includes registration, choice filling, seat allotment, document verification, and reporting.

DocumentVerificationPhase.title: Document Verification & Admission
DocumentVerificationPhase.description: Successful allotment requires timely document verification at designated centres. Essential documents include NEET admit card, result-cum-rank letter, class 10 and 12 mark sheets, category and domicile certificates, photo identity proof, and passport-size photographs.

PreparationTips: Start preparation at least 12-18 months before the exam
Focus on NCERT textbooks for Physics, Chemistry, and Biology
Practice previous year question papers and mock tests regularly
Maintain a consistent study schedule with proper breaks
Join coaching classes or online courses for structured preparation
Stay updated with current affairs in science and medicine
ExamDayGuidelines: Reach exam center at least 1 hour before reporting time
Carry only permitted items: admit card, valid ID, ballpoint pen
Wear light-colored, half-sleeve clothes without buttons/zippers
No electronic devices, watches, or jewelry allowed
Follow COVID-19 safety protocols if applicable
Maintain social distancing and wear masks if required
ApplicationTips: Keep all documents ready before starting application
Use high-quality scanned images for photo and signature
Double-check all personal and academic details
Save application number and password securely
Take printout of confirmation page immediately
Keep multiple copies of all submitted documents
CounsellingPreparation: Research colleges and courses thoroughly before choice filling
Keep all original documents ready for verification
Understand reservation policies and eligibility criteria
Stay updated with counselling schedules and deadlines
Have backup options ready in case of non-allotment
CommonMistakes: Incorrect personal details in application form
Uploading poor quality photos or signatures
Not carrying required documents on exam day
Failing to verify documents during counselling
Not reporting to allotted college within stipulated time

NotificationPhase.title: Notification & Application Start (First week of February 2026)
NotificationPhase.description: The NTA officially announces NEET 2026 about 3 months before exam day. The detailed Information Bulletin is released on the official portal (neet.nta.nic.in), outlining crucial exam policies, eligibility norms, syllabus, exam pattern, application steps, fee structure, and instructions. Candidates registering for the first time must create their profile on the candidate portal. The application window opens for about 4-5 weeks, allowing ample time for form filling. Early registration is advised to avoid last-minute server issues. NTA also announces exam city options, languages offered, and document specifications such as size limits for photograph and signature scans.

ApplicationProcess.title: NEET 2026 Application Process (February to March 2026)
ApplicationProcess.description: Candidates fill demographic details, academic records (Class 10, 12), contact details, and exam preferences. Upload formats: Recent passport-size photo (10-200 KB), signature (4-30 KB) – scanned as per guidelines. Application fee payment is mandatory at this stage. Both online and offline modes (challan facility) may be provided, but digital payment is faster and encouraged. Confirmation page download is a must after successful submission; print and save multiple copies. Single window for correction post submission will be allowed later.

CorrectionWindow.title: Application Correction Window (Third week of March 2026)
CorrectionWindow.description: NTA provides a 3-5 day window to correct details such as name spelling, date of birth, community category, disability status, exam centre city preference, mobile number, and photograph/signature upload errors. The correction facility will not allow alterations in exam subjects or mode, so initial form filling must be done with utmost care. Candidates requesting changes may need to pay an additional correction fee depending on the nature of the modification. It is critical to verify all changes via confirmation receipts after correction window closes.

CityIntimation.title: City Intimation Slip Release (Fourth week of April 2026)
CityIntimation.description: This slip informs candidates of their exact exam city, enabling timely travel arrangements. Candidates should verify exam center details carefully and retain copies for future reference. This step minimizes last-minute surprises regarding test location shifts and helps with accommodation planning by aspirants traveling away from hometown.

AdmitCardRelease.title: Admit Card Release (First week of May 2026)
AdmitCardRelease.description: The admit card acts as the mandatory hall ticket and contains exam venue, date, candidate's photograph, signature, and guidelines. Generally released 20-25 days before the exam. Candidates must download and print multiple copies and verify all printed details for accuracy. Any discrepancy in admit card data must be reported immediately to NTA helplines or via online grievance forms. No candidate is permitted to enter the examination center without a valid printed admit card and photo ID.

ExamDay.title: NEET 2026 Exam Date (Sunday, May 3, 2026)
ExamDay.description: Exam is conducted nationwide and in select international centers simultaneously. Duration is strictly 3 hours (usually 2:00 PM to 5:00 PM IST). No electronic gadgets, calculators, watches, or stationery other than a black ballpoint pen are allowed inside exam halls. Candidates should reach their centers an hour early, follow seating arrangements, and obey invigilation rules. Identification verification and frisking procedures will be strictly followed at centers. Wearing simple attire like light-colored, half-sleeve shirts without buttons or zippers is mandatory to ease security checks. COVID-19 protocols or similar health safety measures, if relevant, will be enforced as per official guidelines.

AnswerKeyPhase.title: Provisional Answer Key Publication & Objection Window (Last week of May 2026)
AnswerKeyPhase.description: The provisional answer key offers transparency by allowing candidates to review correct answers for question paper sets. Challenge window remains open for approximately 3-5 days post-release. Candidates can raise objections against any questions or answers they find incorrect by submitting proof and paying a nominal fee per query. NTA carefully reviews all objections and publishes a final answer key subsequently. The fees for challenges are refundable if objections are found valid.

ResultDeclaration.title: Result Declaration & Final Answer Key (Second/Third week of June 2026)
ResultDeclaration.description: The NEET result is declared via scorecards downloadable from the official portal with individual total marks, sectional marks, percentile rank, All India Rank (AIR), and qualification status. The qualifying cutoff percentiles vary each year per category but typically range from 50th percentile for General to lower percentiles for reserved categories. The final answer key reflecting corrections and objections accepted is released simultaneously with results. Results also serve as the basis for seat allocation in medical/dental colleges across India.

CounsellingProcess.title: Medical Counselling Process (July to August 2026)
CounsellingProcess.description: The Medical Counselling Committee (MCC) handles the All India Quota (15%) centralized counselling, deemed universities, AIIMS, JIPMER, and ESIC institutes. State Authorities conduct separate counselling for 85% State Quota seats. Counselling includes registration, submission of preferences and choices, provisional seat allotments, seat acceptance fee payment, document verification, and final seat confirmation. Multiple rounds of counselling (typically 6 rounds) including mop-up and stray vacancy rounds are conducted to fill remaining seats. Candidates must stay in touch with the MCC and their respective State counselling boards for deadlines and updates.

Introduction.title: NEET 2026 Counselling Process – Complete Expert Guide
Introduction.description: The counselling process for NEET 2026 is the critical phase following the exam result declaration where qualified candidates secure seats in medical and dental colleges throughout India based on their rank, preferences, and reservation category. It is a multi-tier, multi-round process managed centrally and by individual states.

quotas.areasCovered: Seats across India except private/state quota colleges. Includes central universities, deemed universities, AFMC, ESIC, AIIMS, JIPMER seats
Majority of seats reserved for candidates domiciled in the respective states or union territories. Controlled by state counselling authorities.
Counselling conducted by MCC as part of AIQ or separately
Counselling usually conducted by respective states or private managements

responsibilities: Conduct counselling for remaining state quota seats (85%) including government and private medical colleges located within the state
Each state conducts its own registration, seat allotment, document verification process, along with individual eligibility and domicile criteria

CounsellingRoundsAndTheirSignificance.title: Counselling Rounds and Their Significance
CounsellingRoundsAndTheirSignificance.description: NEET UG counselling for 2026 consists of multiple rounds designed to ensure maximum seat usage and multiple opportunities for candidates:

rounds.description: First allotment based on merit and preferences. Seat acceptance and joining mandatory to continue.
For candidates who didn't get a seat in round 1 or want upgradation. Fresh registrations needed.
Also called Round 3, for vacant seats after rounds 1 and 2. Fresh registration and choice filling.
Final chance to fill leftover seats post mop-up round, typically conducted offline.

importantNotes: Candidates who join a seat can opt for 'upgradation' in subsequent rounds
Those who reject or do not participate may lose seat security deposit based on rules

steps.description: Registration on MCC portal (mcc.nic.in) for AIQ and Deemed institutions. State-level portals for state quota counselling. Payment of registration fee and security deposit according to category. Upload necessary certificates and documents.
Candidates fill and lock choices of colleges and courses in order of preference. Multiple choices allowed; lock before deadline. Choices can be modified before locking deadline.
Based on rank, category, quota, and choices. Allotment results declared on MCC or respective state counselling websites. Download provisional and final allotment letters.
Report physically to the allotted institute within specified timelines. Mandatory original document verification as per checklist. Pay admission fees and complete joining process.
Confirm seat acceptance by reporting and fee payment. Failure to report results in seat forfeiture. Candidates who accept seats can participate in further rounds for upgradation.

KeyCounsellingTipsForCandidates.title: Key Counselling Tips for Candidates
tips: Regularly check MCC and respective state counselling portals for notifications
Register and pay fees promptly for each counselling round
Carefully fill choices based on priorities and realistic admission chances
Verify documents in advance to avoid last-minute issues
Attend physical reporting on time; non-reporting leads to seat cancellations
Understand upgradation process and participate to improve seat allotment if desired
Keep multiple backup options for choices
Use MCC helpline and notifications for any support or clarifications

DistinctionBetweenAllIndiaQuotaAndStateQ.title: Distinction Between All India Quota and State Quota Counselling

distinctions.allIndiaQuota: All Indian candidates irrespective of domicile (except specific state limits)
distinctions.stateQuota: Only candidates satisfying state domicile/residency criteria
Conducted separately by each state portal

distinctions.allIndiaQuota: Central, Deemed, AFMC, ESIC, AIIMS, JIPMER
distinctions.stateQuota: Government and Private medical colleges within state

activities: Result declaration and rank card release
Counselling notification by MCC and state authorities
Registration begins for AIQ and state quota counselling

states.specialFeatures: Separate counselling for government and private colleges, domicile certificate required
Online counselling with multiple rounds, rural quota available
7.5% horizontal reservation for government school students

states.conductingAuthority: Directorate of Medical Education and Training (DMET)
states.specialFeatures: Separate counselling for government and private medical colleges

states.conductingAuthority: West Bengal Joint Entrance Examinations Board (WBJEEB)
states.specialFeatures: Online counselling with document verification at designated centers

tips: Research college cutoffs from previous years
Keep 20-30% buffer in your rank for realistic choices
Fill maximum number of choices (up to 200)
Prioritize colleges based on your preferences and realistic chances
Include both government and private colleges for better options
Get all documents attested by gazetted officers
Keep multiple copies of each document
Verify document formats as per counselling authority requirements
Prepare domicile certificate well in advance
Get category certificates from appropriate authorities
Report to allotted college within stipulated time
Carry all original documents for verification
Pay admission fees immediately to confirm seat
Keep receipt of fee payment safely
Understand upgradation process for subsequent rounds
Calculate total cost including tuition, hostel, and other fees
Explore education loan options if needed
Check scholarship opportunities
Plan for multiple rounds of counselling fees
Keep emergency funds for unexpected expenses

mistakes.prevention: Set reminders and register on the first day
Prepare all documents well in advance

mistakes.consequence: Getting undesired college or no seat
mistakes.prevention: Research thoroughly and fill maximum choices
Research complete fee structure before choice filling

CounsellingHelplineAndSupport.title: Counselling Helpline and Support
onlineResources: Official college websites for specific information
Education ministry websites for policy updates

steps.description: Accept the allotted seat by paying the required fees within the stipulated time. This confirms your admission to the college.
Submit all required original documents to the college for verification. Keep attested copies for your records.
Undergo medical examination as required by the college. Some colleges may have specific health requirements.
Apply for hostel accommodation if needed. Check availability and application procedures with the college administration.
Attend orientation programs and begin your medical education journey. Familiarize yourself with college rules and regulations.

DocumentVerification.title: Document Verification & Final Admission (As per Counselling Schedule)
DocumentVerification.description: Candidates must appear for document verification at designated centres. Mandatory documents include NEET Admit Card, Result Letter, Class 10 & 12 Mark sheets, Category & Domicile certificates, PwD certificate (if applicable), and Photo ID (Aadhar, Passport, Voter ID). Original documents and attested photocopies are necessary to prove eligibility. Failure to verify documents or report to the allotted institution within timelines may lead to forfeiture of admission.

PreparationTips: Begin preparation at least 12-18 months ahead of NEET date for conceptual clarity
Focus on NCERT textbooks for Physics, Chemistry, and Biology as the exam closely follows these
Practice previous years' papers and mock tests consistently to improve speed, accuracy, and exam temperament
Create a well-balanced timetable including revision and breaks to avoid burnout
Enroll in reputed coaching or online structured courses for expert guidance
Stay informed on biological sciences advancements and current affairs related to medicine and healthcare
Take care of physical and mental health through proper diet, sleep, and relaxation techniques
ExamDayGuidelines: Arrive at exam center at least 60 minutes before reporting time to complete entry formalities
Carry only essential items: NEET admit card, valid photo ID, transparent water bottle, and personal hand sanitizers if allowed
Follow strict dress code: Light-colored, half-sleeved tops without buttons or metallic accessories
Mobile phones, watches, calculators, study materials, papers, and bags are strictly prohibited inside the exam hall
Use only blue or black ballpoint pens for marking OMR responses
Maintaining silence and cooperating with invigilators is mandatory for smooth conduct
ApplicationBestPractices: Arrange all required certificates and photographs as per prescribed formats before starting the application
Scan images with clear resolution and correct dimensions to avoid rejection
Double-check every data field for accuracy, especially personal details such as name, date of birth, category, and educational details
Keep application number, password, and transaction ID safely for future logins and fee-related queries
Take a printout of the confirmation page and saved copies of the filled form for records and future reference
Monitor emails and SMS for updates on application status and correction windows
CounsellingPreparation: Research colleges, courses, cutoffs, and reservation policies in detail prior to choice filling
Prepare all original and attested documents neatly
Understand the implications of locking choices and the consequences of seat acceptance and withdrawal
Be prepared for successive rounds of counselling to secure best possible admission
Keep backup plans in place in case desired allotments are not made
Stay responsive to official communications and deadlines to avoid disqualification
CommonMistakes: Submitting incomplete or incorrect application forms
Missing application or correction window deadlines
Forgetting to carry admit card and valid ID on exam day
Violating dress code or bringing prohibited items inside exam hall
Failing to complete document verification or reporting to allotted college on time

EligibilityCriteria.Nationality: Indian Nationals, NRIs, OCIs, PIOs, Foreign Nationals
EligibilityCriteria.Education: Passed/appearing 10+2 or equivalent with Physics, Chemistry, Biology/Biotechnology, and English

NationalityAndCitizenship.title: Nationality & Citizenship Eligibility
NationalityAndCitizenship.description: Eligible applicants include a broad spectrum of candidates ensuring inclusivity:
categories: Indian Nationals: Candidates holding Indian citizenship
Non-Resident Indians (NRIs): Indian citizens living abroad but retaining Indian nationality
Overseas Citizens of India (OCIs): Foreign citizens of Indian origin eligible for certain rights similar to NRIs
Persons of Indian Origin (PIOs): People who trace their origin to India as defined by the government
Foreign Nationals: Candidates who hold foreign passports can also apply but must comply with admission rules and seat allotments specific to foreigners

AgeRequirements.title: Age Requirements

minimumAge.requirement: At least 17 years old on or before December 31, 2026
minimumAge.description: Candidates born on or before December 31, 2009, are eligible

upperAgeLimit.description: As per recent Supreme Court rulings and NMC guidelines, there is no upper age limit to appear for NEET 2026. Previous restrictions on upper age were abolished to allow wider candidate participation

AgeRequirements.ageCalculation: The date of birth accepted will be as recorded in Class 10 or equivalent examination board certificates

EducationalQualifications.title: Educational Qualifications
EducationalQualifications.description: Candidates must have achieved or be appearing for a recognized qualifying examination that complies with the following:
requirements: Passing Class: Candidates should have passed or be appearing in Class 12 (10+2) or equivalent examination conducted by recognized boards such as CBSE, ICSE, State Boards, NIOS, or equivalent with practical exams where applicable
Mandatory Subjects: The candidate must have studied the following core subjects from a recognized board/institution:

MinimumMarksRequired.title: Minimum Marks Required in Qualifying Exam

categories.requirement: Minimum aggregate of 50% marks in Physics, Chemistry, and Biology/Biotechnology combined with English as a subject must be secured
Minimum aggregate of 40% marks in Physics, Chemistry and Biology/Biotechnology (combined), with English included as a separate subject
Candidates belonging to PwD in the General category must have at least 45% aggregate marks in the same subjects to be eligible

additionalNotes: Candidates must pass all subjects individually. Aggregate minimum marks are combined across these subjects
Open school/private candidates are eligible if they meet the eligibility criteria and have studied the mandatory subjects

YearOfPassingAndAttempts.title: Year of Passing and Attempt Eligibility
YearOfPassingAndAttempts.yearOfPassing: Candidates who are appearing for their Class 12 board exams in 2026 or have passed in earlier attempts (e.g., 2025, 2024) are eligible to apply
YearOfPassingAndAttempts.numberOfAttempts: There are no restrictions on the number of attempts for appearing in NEET 2026. Candidates can appear multiple times to improve scores without disqualification or penalty

QualifyingCodes.title: Qualifying Codes (Educational Background)
QualifyingCodes.description: NTA categorizes various qualifying criteria with specific codes to properly verify academic eligibility. These include:

codes.description: Currently appearing or passed Class 12 in 2026 and awaiting results
Passed Pre-degree exam in science in India with PCB and English including practicals
Passed any pre-professional or pre-medical exam after Class 12
Currently in the first year of a 3-year degree course
Completed B.Sc. with at least two subjects among Physics, Chemistry, and Biology and passed Class 12
Qualified from foreign countries or equivalent pre-university/Board exams

QualifyingCodes.note: Candidates must choose the correct qualifying code during application to avoid eligibility issues

SpecialCategories.title: Special Categories - PwD and Other Considerations
points: PwD candidates enjoy horizontal reservation and slightly lower minimum marks (45% for General-PwD)
Candidates with Biology/Biotechnology as an additional subject are considered eligible if they meet other criteria but must check latest NMC guidelines at admission time
Candidates from Open Schools or National Institute of Open Schooling (NIOS) are eligible provided they have studied mandatory subjects from recognized boards

DomicileAndStateQuotas.title: Domicile and State Quotas
points: While NEET conducts a centralized exam, admission follows both All India Quota (15%) and State Quota (85%) seat distribution policies
State domicile candidates may have preferential reservation in state counselling rounds as per state regulations
Candidates must produce valid domicile certificates during counselling for state quota admissions

SummaryTable.title: Summary Table: NEET 2026 Core Eligibility Criteria

criteria.details: Indian, NRI, OCI, PIO, Foreign Nationals
Passed/appearing Class 12 or equivalent with PCB & English
50% Gen, 40% Reserved, 45% PwD in PCB & English
No limit on number of attempts
Passed or appearing in 2026 or earlier

ImportantAdditionalNotes.title: Important Additional Notes for NEET 2026 Eligibility
points: Verification and Documentation: Candidates must keep original mark sheets, certificates, and valid photo identification ready for counselling stages
Foreign Nationals: Admission is subject to eligibility verification and seat availability; candidates must comply with All India Quota or specific institute policies
Changes & Updates: Candidates must check the official NEET 2026 information bulletin for any amendments before application
Equivalency of Boards: Students from international boards must ensure equivalency certificates supporting Physics, Chemistry, Biology, and English to qualify
Syllabus Relevance: Eligible candidates should align preparation with the NCERT syllabus covering Class 11-12 levels from recognized boards to ensure exam readiness

Introduction.title: NEET 2026 Eligibility Criteria: In-depth Comprehensive Guide
Introduction.description: NEET 2026 eligibility criteria are prescribed by the National Testing Agency (NTA) under the supervision of the Ministry of Education and National Medical Commission. These criteria maintain uniform standards for admission to undergraduate medical and related courses in India.

NationalityAndCitizenshipCriteria.title: Nationality & Citizenship Criteria
NationalityAndCitizenshipCriteria.description: NEET 2026 welcomes applicants across various nationality categories to ensure broad inclusivity and accommodate Indian diaspora and foreign candidates:
categories: Indian Nationals: Candidates who have Indian citizenship are fully eligible
Non-Resident Indians (NRIs): Indian citizens residing abroad holding Indian passports are eligible under the same category as Indian nationals
Overseas Citizens of India (OCI): Foreign citizens of Indian origin with OCI status enjoy rights similar to NRIs and are eligible to appear in NEET 2026 for admission
Persons of Indian Origin (PIO): Candidates of Indian descent but holding foreign citizenship can apply under PIO category, subject to admission rules
Foreign Nationals: Candidates holding foreign passports can appear for the exam but may have specific admission criteria or capped seat availability as per institute policy or government regulations
NationalityAndCitizenshipCriteria.note: Eligibility is, however, contingent on fulfilling all academic and age-related criteria uniformly across these groups.

AgeRequirementsDetailed.title: Age Requirements: Minimum and Upper Limits

minimumAge.requirement: Candidates must have completed at least 17 years of age on or before December 31, 2026
minimumAge.practicalMeaning: Candidates born on or before December 31, 2009, are eligible
minimumAge.purpose: The minimum age criteria ensures candidates have completed requisite schooling and maturity for medical education

upperAgeLimit.requirement: There is no upper age limit as per the latest Supreme Court and National Medical Commission (NMC) rulings on NEET eligibility
upperAgeLimit.policyChange: This policy change came to remove unnecessary barriers for aspirants who wish to pursue medical education later in life

ageVerification.domestic: Age proof is strictly verified from official Class 10 or equivalent certificates reporting date of birth as recognized by government authorities
ageVerification.foreign: Aspirants from foreign boards must provide equivalency certificates that include DOB verification

EducationalQualificationsDetailed.title: Educational Qualifications and Academic Requirements
EducationalQualificationsDetailed.basicRequirement: Candidates should have passed or be appearing in their Class 12 (10+2) or equivalent examination from recognized boards such as CBSE, ICSE, State Boards, NIOS, or equivalent international boards whose exam is recognized by the Association of Indian Universities (AIU)
EducationalQualificationsDetailed.practicalExams: The qualifying exam must include practical exams where applicable to provide hands-on experience in core science subjects
mandatorySubjects: English as a compulsory language subject
specialCases: Candidates with Biology/Biotechnology as an additional subject but meeting minimum eligibility can also apply; however, admission will follow NMC guidelines during seat allocation
Open school or private candidates are eligible if they fulfill the above subject requirements and minimum marks
Candidates from international boards need equivalency certificates from AIU to verify academic standing and subject coverage

MinimumRequiredMarksDetailed.title: Minimum Required Marks (Qualifying Nature)

categories.requirement: Minimum aggregate of 50% marks in Physics, Chemistry, and Biology/Biotechnology combined along with English as a passing subject
A minimum aggregate of 40% marks combined in PCB, with English as compulsory

categories.category: Persons with Disability (PwD) in General Category
categories.requirement: Minimum 45% marks in PCB combined, with passing marks in English

importantNotes: Minimum passing marks must be achieved in all subjects individually
Aggregate percentages cover combined marks across PCB only, excluding other subjects
This assures candidates have a foundational understanding of science basics needed for medical education

YearOfPassingAndAttemptsDetailed.title: Year of Passing and Number of Attempts
YearOfPassingAndAttemptsDetailed.yearOfPassing: Candidates appearing for the Class 12 board examinations in 2026 or who have passed the qualifying exam in 2024 or 2025 are eligible to apply
YearOfPassingAndAttemptsDetailed.numberOfAttempts: No restriction is placed on the number of attempts candidates can take to appear for NEET; aspirants may attempt multiple times in consecutive or non-consecutive years without penalty
YearOfPassingAndAttemptsDetailed.flexibility: Candidates intending to improve scores or seek admission after re-attempt can reappear according to their preparation and strategy
YearOfPassingAndAttemptsDetailed.purpose: This attempt flexibility supports lifelong learning and multiple entry chances into medicine

QualifyingCodesDetailed.title: Qualifying Codes for Academic Background (NEET Application Specific)
QualifyingCodesDetailed.description: NTA assigns qualifying codes to candidates based on their academic status to streamline eligibility verification:

codes.description: Currently appearing in Class 12 exams in 2026; awaiting results
Passed pre-degree exam in science from an Indian board/university with PCB and practicals
Passed any pre-professional or pre-medical exam after Class 12 physical examinations
Currently in first year of a three-year degree course
Completed B.Sc. with at least two subjects (Physics, Chemistry, Biology); passed Class 12 PCB
Appeared for any other exam except Class 12 (e.g., Pre-University) with practical components

QualifyingCodesDetailed.importantNote: Candidates must accurately select the correct qualifying code on application or face eligibility delays. Documentation supporting the selected code is mandatory during counselling.

SpecialConsiderations.title: Special Considerations for PwD and Open School Candidates
points: Persons with Disabilities have a horizontal reservation of 5%, and minimum eligibility marks are slightly relaxed to 45% for General-PwD category
Candidates who have completed schooling via Open Schooling or NIOS under recognized boards are eligible for NEET 2026, given they fulfill core subject and minimum marks criteria
Aspirants with Biology or Biotechnology as an additional rather than compulsory subject need to verify latest NMC guidelines prior to admission but are generally eligible to apply

DomicileAndReservationPolicies.title: Domicile, State Quotas and Reservation Policies
DomicileAndReservationPolicies.description: While NEET is a national-level centralized examination, admission seats are distributed as:

quotaDistribution.description: Filled through centralized counselling by MCC based on NEET merit
Seats allocated by respective State Admission Authorities, with preference for domicile candidates

additionalRequirements: Candidates must possess valid domicile certificates for state quota admissions; states vary in their additional eligibility
Reservation policies per category apply uniformly in both AIQ and state quota seats

SummaryTableDetailed.title: Summary Table: NEET 2026 Core Eligibility Overview

criteria.details: Indian, NRI, OCI, PIO, Foreign Nationals
Passed/appearing Class 12 (10+2) or equivalent with Physics, Chemistry, Biology/Biotech, and English
Passed or appearing in 2026 or prior years
Seven codes based on academic background

AdditionalImportantNotesDetailed.title: Additional Important Notes
points: Candidates must keep all original academic and identity documents ready for verification during counselling
Foreign nationals must comply with institute-specific rules and seat availability; transcripts and equivalency certificates may be required
Equivalency certificates must certify that the foreign exam corresponds to 10+2 with PCB and English
Candidates must regularly verify updates from the official NEET website and information bulletins for any changes in criteria
Syllabus compliance: Candidates should base preparation on the NCERT Class 11 and 12 syllabus relevant to Physics, Chemistry, and Biology for exam readiness

Introduction.title: NEET 2026 Application Process: Complete Step-by-Step Guide
Introduction.description: NEET 2026 registration is a fully online process managed exclusively by the National Testing Agency (NTA) via their official portals: nta.ac.in or neet.nta.nic.in. The registration window typically spans from February to March 2026, providing candidates sufficient time to complete the application accurately.

Step1Registration.title: Step 1: Registration on Official Portal
steps: Visit the official NTA NEET website: nta.ac.in or neet.nta.nic.in
Click on the 'New Registration' or 'Fill Registration Form' link visible on the homepage during the release period
Carefully read all instructions and guidelines provided by NTA before proceeding
Fill basic details such as name, date of birth, gender, nationality, email ID, and mobile number. These must be exactly as per official documents to avoid discrepancies
Create a strong password and set security questions for profile protection
Submit the registration form to receive your unique application number and password on your registered email and mobile via OTP confirmation
Save these credentials securely as they will be required for login to complete the application

Step2ApplicationForm.title: Step 2: Filling the Application Form
Step2ApplicationForm.description: Log in using the application number and password provided during registration. Carefully fill in detailed information under the following sections:

sections.details: Full name, mother's and father's name, date of birth, gender, category, PwD status
Permanent and correspondence address with postal codes
Board of examination for Class 10 and 12, passing year, roll numbers, marks obtained or appearing status
Choose the medium of question paper (one of 13 languages) and two preferred exam cities in order of priority
Declaration regarding wearing customary dress if it conflicts with dress code

Step2ApplicationForm.importantNote: Every field must be filled carefully; errors here can lead to rejection or difficulty later. The system will not allow incomplete submissions.

Step3DocumentUpload.title: Step 3: Uploading Documents
Step3DocumentUpload.description: Prepare the following documents in digital form, ensuring compliance with NTA's prescribed format and size:

documents.specifications: Scanned fingerprint JPG/JPEG, 10 KB – 50 KB (if applicable)
Scanned copy in PDF/JPG, clear and legible
Aadhaar Card, Passport, Voter ID, PAN Card, etc.

Step3DocumentUpload.warning: Uploading multiple formats or poor quality images will lead to form rejection.

Step4FeePayment.title: Step 4: Fee Payment
Step4FeePayment.description: The application fee can be paid online through Net Banking, Debit Card, Credit Card, UPI, or other accepted digital transactions.
importantNotes: Fee is non-refundable once paid, so double-check category and application details before payment
After successful payment, candidates receive confirmation via email/SMS
Keep payment receipts and confirmation screenshots safe for reference

Step5ReviewSubmission.title: Step 5: Review and Final Submission
steps: Before final submission, thoroughly review all application data and uploaded documents
Once submitted, corrections can only be made in the separate correction window
Candidates must confirm submission by clicking 'Yes, submit' or similar prompt
Download and print the confirmation page immediately after submission for records. This page acts as proof of successful application

PostSubmissionCorrection.title: Post-Submission: Application Correction Window
PostSubmissionCorrection.description: After the application deadline, NTA opens a correction window (usually a few days) where candidates can amend certain details like exam city, spelling corrections, category changes, and document uploads.
importantNotes: Candidates need to pay an additional fee for certain changes during this period
It is the final opportunity to ensure application accuracy before admit card generation

ImportantTips.title: Important Tips for NEET 2026 Application Form
tips: Prepare documentation beforehand: Keep all necessary documents scanned and ready as per NTA specifications before starting your application
Use a stable internet connection: To avoid data loss or form submission errors
Enter data carefully: Small errors in names, dates, or identification numbers may lead to verification issues later
Photograph and signature clarity: Must be in color, recent, and clear to avoid rejection
Unique credentials: Store your application number and password securely for login and retrieval
Timely submission: Avoid waiting till the last day of application to prevent server overload or payment gateway issues
Keep multiple printouts: For future use during admit card download, counselling, and admission processes

DocumentsChecklist.title: Documents Checklist for NEET 2026 Application
documents: Recent passport-size photograph (centered clear face, white background)
Candidate signature on white paper using blue/black ink
Left hand thumb impression scans (colored) if applicable
Class 10/pass certificate or mark sheet for age verification
Class 12 or equivalent qualifying exam mark sheet or admit card/registration document (if available)
Category certificate (SC/ST/OBC/EWS) issued by competent authority, if applicable
PwD certificate issued by medical authority, if applicable
Valid photo ID proof (Aadhaar, Passport, PAN, Voter ID)

faqs.question: Can I change my exam center after submission?
faqs.answer: Changes can be requested only during the correction period and are subject to availability.

faqs.question: What if my photo/signature gets rejected?
faqs.answer: You will be informed during the correction window to upload compliant images.

faqs.question: Is offline application mode available?
faqs.answer: No, NEET registration is strictly online.

faqs.question: What if application fee payment fails?
faqs.answer: Retry payment before the deadline using alternative modes or contact helpline.

faqs.question: Are there any concessions in fees?
faqs.answer: Yes, candidates from reserved categories pay reduced fees as mentioned above.

Introduction.title: NEET 2026 Application Process: Exhaustive Step-by-Step Guide for Aspirants
Introduction.description: The NEET 2026 application is a fully online process managed by the National Testing Agency (NTA). This guide explores every detail from registration to final submission and post-submission activities, ensuring candidates have a flawless experience applying for NEET UG 2026.

ApplicationModeAndPortal.title: Application Mode and Portal
points: Mode: NEET 2026 applications can be submitted only online via the official NTA web portals: nta.ac.in and neet.nta.nic.in
No offline or paper applications are accepted
The online application system is accessible 24/7 during the application window but may experience peak load near deadlines

timeline.details: NTA issues official notification and information bulletin
Online portal opens for registration and application filling
Last day to complete and submit NEET 2026 application
Candidates can make limited corrections to application details

Step1RegistrationDetailed.title: Step 1: Registration on NTA Portal
steps: Visit nta.ac.in or neet.nta.nic.in and click on the 'New Registration' button
Carefully read all instructions and eligibility criteria
Enter personal details exactly as they appear on government-issued identification proof. This includes:
Full name
Date of birth
Gender
Nationality
Email ID (unique and valid)
Mobile number (active for OTP verification)
Create a secure password and select security questions to protect your profile
Verify registration via OTPs sent to your email and phone
On successful registration, save your unique application number and password securely because they will be needed to log in and complete application and subsequent processes

Step2ApplicationFormDetailed.title: Step 2: Filling the Application Form
Step2ApplicationFormDetailed.description: After successful registration, login on the portal to proceed with application:

sections.description: Enter detailed personal particulars, including parents' names, category status, and disability status if applicable
Permanent and correspondence addresses with postal codes. Communication details will be used to send official updates and admit card info
Board of examination for Class 10 and Class 12 or equivalent. Year of passing or appearing status. Roll numbers and marks obtained, if applicable
Select question paper language from 13 official languages offered. Choose two preferred exam cities in order of preference; centers are allocated based on availability
Provide parents'/guardians' occupation, highest education level, and annual income. Make any declarations about customary dress that may conflict with exam dress code

Step2ApplicationFormDetailed.importantNote: The application system validates entries and will not allow incomplete forms to be submitted

Step3DocumentUploadDetailed.title: Step 3: Uploading Scanned Documents
Step3DocumentUploadDetailed.description: Candidates must upload the following documents as per NTA specifications:

documents.notes: Blue/Black ink signature on white paper

documents.size: Aadhaar, Passport, PAN, Voter ID accepted

uploadTips: Use clear, recent, and compliant documents (pixelated or poor images lead to rejection)
Avoid uploading multiple formats of the same document to prevent errors
Preview uploaded images carefully before final submission

Step4FeePaymentDetailed.title: Step 4: Application Fee Payment
Step4FeePaymentDetailed.description: The application fee must be paid online as a precondition for form submission:
paymentMethods: UPI Payment Apps (BHIM, Google Pay, PhonePe, etc.)
importantNotes: Keep digital receipts and payment confirmation SMS/email as proof
Payment gateway issues must be resolved promptly by retrying or contacting helplines before the deadline

Step5ReviewSubmissionDetailed.title: Step 5: Review & Final Submission
steps: Thoroughly cross-check all entered data and uploaded documents for accuracy and completeness before final submission
Once submitted, no major edits can be made except limited corrections during the correction window
Confirm submission with the on-screen prompt (such as 'Yes, Submit')
Download and print the confirmation page after submission as this is an official receipt of application. Multiple copies recommended for future reference during the exam and counselling

PostSubmissionCorrectionDetailed.title: Post-Submission: Correction Window
PostSubmissionCorrectionDetailed.description: NTA opens a short correction window post application deadline where limited fields can be amended:
importantNotes: Candidates must utilize this window carefully as no further changes are allowed after this

CommonChallengesAndSolutions.title: Common Challenges & How to Overcome Them

challenges.solution: Use a stable broadband or mobile network; avoid last-minute submissions
Follow size/format guidelines strictly; scan documents using recommended apps or hardware
Enter personal info exactly as per official documents; discrepancies can cause cancellation
Retry with different modes, check bank limits, use official helpline
Use password recovery options on the portal or reach out to NTA support

BestPractices.title: Suggested Best Practices
practices: Begin preparation of documents well in advance
Take printouts of filled form sections and keep scanned copies of all documents safely
Double-check eligibility criteria before applying to avoid application rejection
Apply at least a week before the deadline to accommodate any technical issues
Maintain frequent communication with NTA's official channels for latest updates and support

DocumentsChecklistDetailed.title: Documents Checklist for NEET 2026 Application
documents: Recent passport-size photo with white background
Signature on plain white paper in black/blue ink
Class 10 passing certificate or mark sheet (DOB proof)
Class 12 mark sheet or equivalent (if available)
Valid category certificate for reserved classes (SC, ST, OBC, EWS)
Government-issued identity card (Aadhaar, Passport, PAN, etc.)

faqs.question: Can I apply offline?
faqs.answer: No, NEET application is only accepted online

faqs.question: Can I change exam city after submission?
faqs.answer: City changes are allowed only during the correction window and subject to availability

faqs.question: What if photo/signature gets rejected?
faqs.answer: You will be notified to re-upload valid documents during the correction window

faqs.question: Is fee refundable upon withdrawal?
faqs.answer: No, the application fee is non-refundable under any circumstances

Introduction.title: NEET 2026 Exam Pattern – Complete Overview
Introduction.description: The National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) 2026, conducted by the National Testing Agency (NTA), is the single national-level medical entrance exam for admission to MBBS, BDS, BAMS, BHMS, BSMS, BUMS, nursing, and other allied medical courses across India. It evaluates candidates' understanding of Physics, Chemistry, and Biology at the 10+2 level.

features.detail: +4 for correct, -1 for incorrect, 0 for unattempted
10+2 or equivalent with PCB and English

SectionWiseDistribution.title: Section-wise Distribution
SectionWiseDistribution.description: Each subject (Physics, Chemistry, Botany, and Zoology) is divided into two sections:
SectionWiseDistribution.note: The optional question pattern (Section B) helps reduce pressure and allows flexibility in case certain topics are uncertain to students.

subjects.subject: Physics
subjects.class11Topics: Physical world, Units & Measurements, Motion, Laws of Motion, Work Energy & Power, Gravitation, Thermodynamics, Oscillations & Waves
subjects.class12Topics: Current Electricity, Magnetism, EMI, Alternating Current, Optics, Modern Physics
subjects.difficultyLevel: Generally moderate to tough; requires conceptual clarity and numerical practice

subjects.subject: Chemistry
subjects.class11Topics: Basic concepts, Atomic Structure, Chemical Bonding, Thermodynamics, States of Matter, Equilibrium
subjects.class12Topics: Solid State, Solutions, Electrochemistry, Coordination Compounds, Biomolecules, Polymers
subjects.difficultyLevel: Moderate; formula-based and conceptual understanding both needed

subjects.subject: Biology (Botany + Zoology)
subjects.class11Topics: Diversity of Living Organisms, Structural Organization in Plants & Animals, Cell Biology, Plant Physiology, Human Physiology
subjects.class12Topics: Reproduction, Genetics & Evolution, Biology in Human Welfare, Ecology, Biotechnology
subjects.difficultyLevel: Easy to moderate; concept + memory-intensive; most scoring subject

MarkingBreakdownAndScoringLogic.title: Marking Breakdown and Scoring Logic
scoringDetails: Minimum marks: 0 (negative marking can decrease score)
PwD categories: Varying slightly per year

LanguageOptionsAndCodeMapping.title: Language Options and Code Mapping
LanguageOptionsAndCodeMapping.description: NEET 2026 will be conducted in 13 languages, and each language selection determines the question paper code provided at the exam center:

languages.availableCenters: Gujarat, Dadra & Nagar Haveli, Daman & Diu

importantNotes: Candidates opting for a regional language will receive a bilingual paper (regional + English)
In case of translation discrepancies, English version will prevail

ExamLogisticsAndAdministration.title: Exam Logistics and Administration
points: OMR-based Pen & Paper Test: Candidates use a black/blue ballpoint pen to mark answers
Paper Distribution: All candidates receive the same number of questions in four different sets, shuffled for security
Answer Sheet: Two copies—Original (submitted) and Candidate copy (retained)
Center Allotment: Based on preferences and availability
Identity Proof Requirement: Aadhaar Card, PAN, Passport, or School ID mandatory with admit card

QuestionDifficultyAnalysis.title: Question Difficulty Analysis (Approx. Trend from Past Years)
QuestionDifficultyAnalysis.note: Biology dominates the paper (50% of total marks), making it the most scoring section for high-rank aspirants.

SyllabusBasis.title: Syllabus Basis
SyllabusBasis.description: The NEET 2026 syllabus is aligned with NCERT Class 11 and Class 12 frameworks. No new topics from foreign or state boards are expected, maintaining parity across educational boards.

ResultAndScoringInsights.title: Result and Scoring Insights
points: Raw Score Range: 0–720
All India Rank (AIR): Based on total marks secured and tie-breaking criteria:
1. Higher marks in Biology
2. Higher marks in Chemistry
3. Fewer incorrect answers overall
4. Older age (if tie persists)

Introduction.title: NEET 2026 Exam Pattern – Extended Insights
Introduction.description: Here is a much more detailed and expanded insight into the NEET 2026 exam pattern, chapter-wise weightage, and important study strategies.

GeneralExamStructureRecap.title: General Exam Structure Recap
features: Time Duration: 3 hours (extra 65 minutes for PwBD)
Marking Scheme: +4 correct, -1 incorrect, 0 no response
Languages: 13 including English, Hindi, regional languages

ChapterWiseWeightageOverview.title: Chapter-Wise Weightage Overview
ChapterWiseWeightageOverview.description: Understanding chapter-wise weightage for NEET 2026 enables efficient preparation and scoring focus. It allows candidates to prioritize studying high-weightage chapters and manage time wisely.

PhysicsChapterWeightage.title: Physics Chapter Weightage (Percentage and Approximate Number of Questions)

chapters.chapter: System of Particles and Rotational Motion
Mechanical Properties of Solids and Fluids

PhysicsChapterWeightage.note: Chapters like Electrostatics, Current Electricity, and Optics collectively form a significant portion, requiring solid focus.

ChemistryChapterWeightage.title: Chemistry Chapter Weightage
ChemistryChapterWeightage.description: Chemistry is evenly divided among Physical Chemistry, Inorganic Chemistry, and Organic Chemistry topics, with the following weightage approximation:

BiologyChapterWeightage.title: Biology Chapter Weightage (Botany and Zoology)
BiologyChapterWeightage.description: Biology carries the largest weightage with 90 questions split equally between Botany and Zoology.

syllabusUpdatesAndTips.title: Syllabus Updates and Tips
points: The syllabus is strictly NCERT-based for class 11 and 12
Some chapters were removed and some new topics added recently
Candidates should thoroughly cover all topics
Using NCERT textbooks remains crucial
Supplement with reference books for deeper practice

strategicPreparationTips.title: Strategic Preparation Tips
points: Prioritize chapters with higher marks weightage but don't neglect basics
Practice previous years' question papers for exam pattern familiarity
Time management: Allocate study time proportionally to chapter weight
Use mock tests and revision notes
Make short notes for important facts, especially in Biology

examDayInstructions.title: Exam Day Instructions
points: Reach center early with admit card and valid ID proofs
Use blue/black ballpoint pen only
No electronic gadgets allowed
Stay calm and manage time per section

Syllabus.Notes: Optional/choice questions in Section B to accommodate syllabus reductions

Introduction.title: NEET 2026 Syllabus – Comprehensive Guide
Introduction.description: The NEET 2026 syllabus is the official curriculum prescribed by the National Medical Commission (NMC) and conducted by the National Testing Agency (NTA). It covers detailed topics from Classes 11 and 12 NCERT curriculum in Physics, Chemistry, and Biology (Botany and Zoology) to ensure parity across education boards, helping prospective medical aspirants prepare systematically.

SyllabusStructureOverview.title: Syllabus Structure Overview
SyllabusStructureOverview.note: Total chapters: ~79 covering all fundamental concepts, with no optional questions now. All 180 questions are compulsory.

physicsSyllabus.title: Physics Syllabus (Class 11 & 12)
physicsSyllabus.class11Topics: Physics and measurement, Kinematics, Laws of Motion, Work Energy Power, Rotational Motion, Gravitation, Properties of solids and fluids, Thermodynamics, Kinetic theory of gases, Oscillations and waves
physicsSyllabus.class12Topics: Electrostatics, Current Electricity, Magnetic Effects of Current, Electromagnetic Induction and Alternating Currents, Electromagnetic Waves, Optics, Dual Nature of Matter and Radiation, Atoms and Nuclei, Electronic Devices
physicsSyllabus.keyInsights: Topics like Thermodynamics, Electrostatics, and Electromagnetism carry significant weight. Experimental skills related questions are also included to test conceptual clarity.

chemistrySyllabus.title: Chemistry Syllabus (Class 11 & 12)
chemistrySyllabus.class11Topics: Some basic concepts, Atomic Structure, Classification of Elements, Chemical Bonding, Thermodynamics, Equilibrium, Redox Reactions, p-Block Elements, Organic Chemistry - Basics, Hydrocarbons
chemistrySyllabus.class12Topics: Solutions, Electrochemistry, Chemical Kinetics, p-Block elements, d and f block elements, Coordination Compounds, Haloalkanes and Haloarenes, Alcohols, Phenols and Ethers, Aldehydes, Ketones and Carboxylic acids, Organic compounds containing Nitrogen, Biomolecules, Polymers
chemistrySyllabus.importantNote: Some chapters have been omitted recently by the NMC, e.g., States of Matter, Hydrogen, Metallurgy, Polymers, and Chemistry in Everyday Life.

biologySyllabus.title: Biology Syllabus (Class 11 & 12, Botany and Zoology)
biologySyllabus.class11Topics: Diversity of Living Organisms, Structural Organisation in Animals and Plants, Cell Structure and Function, Plant Physiology, Human Physiology, Reproduction, Genetics and Evolution, Biology and Human Welfare, Biotechnology and its Applications, Ecology and Environment
biologySyllabus.class12Topics: Reproduction in Organisms, Human Reproduction, Reproductive Health, Genetics and Evolution, Biology and Human Welfare, Biotechnology - Principles and Processes, Human Health and Disease, Ecology, Environment and Biodiversity
biologySyllabus.keyInsights: Biology holds 50% weightage making it the most scoring subject; focus on conceptual clarity and memorization.

ChangesInSyllabusAndExamPattern.title: Changes in Syllabus and Exam Pattern
changes: No Optional Questions: NTA removed optional questions (Section B) starting from NEET UG 2025 onwards, maintaining 180 compulsory questions for NEET 2026
Duration: 180 minutes for the exam, reduced from previous 200 minutes, aligned with removal of optional questions
Strict NCERT Alignment: Only NCERT Class 11 & 12 topics are tested with some content removal to reduce syllabus load

PreparationFocusAreas.title: Preparation Focus Areas
areas: Strong emphasis on mastering all chapters completely due to all questions being compulsory
Balanced preparation across Physics (concept + numerical), Chemistry (conceptual + formulas), and Biology (concept + memory)
Utilize NCERT textbooks as primary study material
Practice previous years' question papers and mock tests to understand question trends and difficulty

LanguageAndMedium.title: Language and Medium
LanguageAndMedium.description: Exam is offered in 13 languages including English, Hindi, Assamese, Bengali, Gujarati, Kannada, Malayalam, Marathi, Odia, Punjabi, Tamil, Telugu, and Urdu. Candidates select language at registration; question paper is bilingual (regional + English) except English-only papers.

subjects.subject: Physics
subjects.importantTopics: Thermodynamics, Electrostatics, Current Electricity, Optics, Mechanics, Modern Physics

subjects.subject: Chemistry
subjects.importantTopics: Chemical Bonding, Organic Chemistry Basics, Coordination Compounds, Electrochemistry, p-block Elements, Biomolecules

subjects.subject: Biology
subjects.importantTopics: Genetics, Human Physiology, Reproduction, Ecology, Cell Structure, Evolution

Introduction.title: NEET 2026 Syllabus – In-Depth Comprehensive Guide
Introduction.description: The NEET 2026 syllabus prescribed by the National Medical Commission (NMC) is rigorously based on the Classes 11 and 12 NCERT curriculum for Physics, Chemistry, and Biology (Botany & Zoology). The National Testing Agency (NTA) administers the exam as per this syllabus ensuring it is uniform across all Indian education boards.

SyllabusStructureAtAGlance.title: Syllabus Structure at a Glance
SyllabusStructureAtAGlance.note: Total ~79 chapters covering the entire foundational concepts with all 180 questions compulsory (no optional ones).

physicsSyllabus.title: PHYSICS Syllabus (Class 11 & 12 NCERT)
class11Topics: Motion of Systems of Particles and Rigid Body (Rotational Motion)
Properties of Bulk Matter (Solids and Fluids)
Behaviour of Perfect Gas and Kinetic Theory
class12Topics: Magnetic Effects of Current and Magnetism
Dual Nature of Matter and Radiation
physicsSyllabus.examFocus: Emphasis on conceptual understanding as well as numerical problem-solving. Experimental skills questions on measurement, significant figures, errors, etc. Topics like Thermodynamics, Optics, Modern Physics are high-yield.

chemistrySyllabus.title: CHEMISTRY Syllabus (Class 11 & 12 NCERT)
class11Topics: Classification of Elements and Periodicity in Properties
States of Matter: Gases and Liquids (Reduced emphasis)
The s-Block Elements (Alkali and Alkaline earth metals)
Organic Chemistry: Some Basic Principles and Techniques
class12Topics: The p-Block Elements (Elements of group 15 and 16)
The d and f Block Elements
chemistrySyllabus.notableOmissions: Certain topics like Metallurgy, States of Matter (in depth), and some Organic Polymers have been removed to reduce exam load.

biologySyllabus.title: BIOLOGY Syllabus (Botany & Zoology, Class 11 & 12 NCERT)
class11Topics: Structural Organisation in Animals and Plants
Reproduction (Sexual and Asexual in Plants and Animals)
Biotechnology and Its Applications (Principles and Processes)
class12Topics: Biology and Human Welfare (Health, Disease Prevention)
biologySyllabus.examFocus: Biology accounts for 50% of the questions. Heavy focus on physiology, genetics, evolution, ecology. Combines both understanding and memorization skills.

ImportantSyllabusUpdatesForNEET2026.title: Important Syllabus Updates for NEET 2026
updates: No Optional Questions: The Section B optional question pattern was withdrawn from NEET 2025 onwards. All questions in NEET 2026 (180 MCQs) are compulsory to attempt
Duration Change: Exam time reduced to 3 hours (180 minutes) from earlier 3 hours 20 minutes to accommodate removal of optional questions
Strict NCERT Alignment: NEET tests only NCERT Class 11 and 12 syllabus with some content dropped for syllabus reduction and uniformity

ExamAndPreparationHighlights.title: Exam & Preparation Highlights
highlights: Comprehensive Coverage: Full NCERT syllabus for Class 11 & 12 in all three subjects
Balanced Study: Equal attention needed to Physics, Chemistry, and Biology
Practice: Use NCERT textbooks, solved papers, mock tests, and previous years' questions
Focus: Prioritize high-weightage chapters but thoroughly revise the entire syllabus
Concept + Memory: Physics and Chemistry emphasize conceptual + numerical, Biology is concept + factual memory

LanguageMediumAndExamFormat.title: Language Medium & Exam Format
LanguageMediumAndExamFormat.description: NEET 2026 is conducted in 13 languages: English, Hindi, Assamese, Bengali, Gujarati, Kannada, Malayalam, Marathi, Odia, Punjabi, Tamil, Telugu, Urdu. Most regional languages are bilingual papers (regional language + English). Exam mode is pen-paper, OMR-based.

SampleInDepthChapterListings.title: Sample In-Depth Chapter Listings (Physics)
chapters: Physical world and measurement: Units, dimensions, errors
Kinematics: Laws of motion, velocity, acceleration
Work, Energy, Power: Conservation laws, work done by force
Rotational Motion: Torque, moment of inertia
Waves & Oscillations: Simple harmonic motion, wave motion
Electrostatics: Coulomb's law, electric field and potential
Modern Physics: Photoelectric effect, nucleus properties

Introduction.title: NEET 2026 Expected Cutoff – Detailed Analysis
Introduction.description: The expected cutoff for NEET 2026 varies by category and percentile, influenced by factors like exam difficulty, number of candidates, and seat availability. Here's an extensively detailed breakdown and analysis of the expected cutoff marks and percentiles for NEET 2026, expanding 10x from the basic summary.

WhatIsNEETCutoff.title: What is NEET Cutoff?
points: The NEET cutoff refers to the minimum marks a candidate must secure to qualify for admission to medical, dental, and AYUSH courses
Cutoffs are released category-wise and percentile-wise, ensuring fairness by ranking candidates relative to their peers

CutoffPercentilesAndMarksByCategory.title: Cutoff Percentiles and Marks by Category

categories.additionalNotes: Highest cutoff due to more applicants and competition
Lower cutoff to support reserved category candidates
Persons with disability in General category

FactorsAffectingNEET2026Cutoff.title: Factors Affecting NEET 2026 Cutoff
factors: Number of Candidates: More candidates typically raise cutoffs due to stiffer competition
Difficulty Level: Easier exams make higher cutoffs; harder papers reduce cutoff marks
Seat Availability: Limited government and private seats increase cutoff pressure
Reservation Policies: PwD and reserved categories have lower cutoffs as per government norms
Normalization and Percentile Calculation: Adjusted by NTA to account for multi-session exam variations

HistoricalCutoffTrends.title: Historical Cutoff Trends (Last 5 Years)
HistoricalCutoffTrends.note: NEET 2026 expected cutoffs fall within these stable ranges with minor fluctuations.

CutoffPercentileExplanation.title: Cutoff Percentile Explanation
explanations: The 50th percentile cutoff for General category means that a candidate must score better than at least 50% of all candidates
For OBC/SC/ST categories, 40th percentile means clearing lower relative scores compared to general candidates
PwD candidates have a 45th percentile cutoff in General and 40th in reserved categories, to support inclusivity

categories.description: Cutoff marks range expected between 711 (perfect score) and 135 (passing threshold). Top rankers score in the 650-720 range; to secure medical seats, aim for 600+ marks.
The qualifying score is lower, ranging typically between 134 and 107 marks. Reserved candidates scoring above 110 are typically qualified for counseling.
General-PwD cutoff ranges between 133 and 120, while reserved categories can qualify from as low as 107 up to 119 marks depending on the year.

ScoringStrategyToClearCutoff.title: Scoring Strategy to Clear Cutoff
strategies: Aim for accuracy over attempt quantity due to negative marking (-1 for wrong answers)
Minimum attempts to clear cutoff generally lie around 100 to 120 questions correctly answered
Strong performance in Biology is critical as it carries 50% of total weight

FinalNotes.title: Final Notes
notes: Official NTA cutoff for 2026 will be published after results release in June 2026
Candidates are encouraged to target scores 20-30 marks above expected cutoff to secure good chances during counseling
Percentiles ensure fair normalization for multiple exam shifts/days
This detailed understanding should assist aspirants to set target scores realistically, plan preparation intelligently, and navigate counselling effectively for NEET 2026 admissions

Introduction.title: NEET 2026 Seats Availability and Reservation Policy – Comprehensive Overview
Introduction.description: NEET 2026 is the gateway for admissions into various medical and allied health courses across India. Knowing detailed seat availability and reservation policies is essential for aspirants to strategize admission planning.

courses.remarks: Includes government, private, deemed universities, AIIMS, JIPMER, and ESIC colleges
Dentistry seats in government and private colleges
Includes courses like Homeopathy, Unani, Siddha, and paramedical streams

MBBSSeatsDetailedBreakdown.title: MBBS Seats Detailed Breakdown (2025–2026 latest data)

distribution.esicAfmcOtherCentral: ESIC, AFMC, other central institutes included

BDSSeatsAvailability.title: BDS Seats Availability
BDSSeatsAvailability.description: Total BDS seats available across India are approximately 27,868. Included across government and private dental colleges. Major contributors include states with older dental college infrastructure like Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra, Karnataka.

ReservationPolicy.title: Reservation Policy for NEET Seats Across India

explanation.horizontalReservation: 5% PwD seats horizontally spread over all categories

quotas.description: of total seats reserved for all India counselling
seats filled through respective state counselling
Seats filled under AIQ via MCC

RecentTrendsInSeatIncrease.title: Recent Trends in Seat Increase
trends: Over recent years, the government has added approximately 5,000 to 10,000 new MBBS seats annually
New medical colleges have been opened in states like Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, and Northeastern states to improve accessibility
Efforts are ongoing to increase seats in underserved regions

SeatAvailabilityImpactOnAdmission.title: Seat Availability Impact on Admission
impacts: Increased seats have slightly eased competition but cutoffs remain high due to large candidates count
Government college seats remain competitive; private/deemed seats are more available but costlier
Reservation policies ensure diverse representation but affect general category admission chances

AdditionalInsights.title: Additional Insights
insights: For BAMS and other AYUSH, seats are also reserved as per central and state policies
Veterinary seats (BVSc & AH) are limited but crucial for allied sciences
Counselling strategy should consider quota type, category reservation, and course preference

Counselling.ConductedBy: MCC (AIQ, Deemed/Central/AFMC, ESIC, AIIMS, JIPMER) & State Authorities

Introduction.title: NEET 2026 Counselling Process – Complete Expert Guide
Introduction.description: The counselling process for NEET 2026 is the critical phase following the exam result declaration where qualified candidates secure seats in medical and dental colleges throughout India based on their rank, preferences, and reservation category. It is a multi-tier, multi-round process managed centrally and by individual states.

quotas.areasCovered: Seats across India except private/state quota colleges. Includes central universities, deemed universities, AFMC, ESIC, AIIMS, JIPMER seats
Majority of seats reserved for candidates domiciled in the respective states or union territories. Controlled by state counselling authorities.
Counselling conducted by MCC as part of AIQ or separately
Counselling usually conducted by respective states or private managements

responsibilities: Conduct counselling for remaining state quota seats (85%) including government and private medical colleges located within the state
Each state conducts its own registration, seat allotment, document verification process, along with individual eligibility and domicile criteria

CounsellingRoundsAndTheirSignificance.title: Counselling Rounds and Their Significance
CounsellingRoundsAndTheirSignificance.description: NEET UG counselling for 2026 consists of multiple rounds designed to ensure maximum seat usage and multiple opportunities for candidates:

rounds.description: First allotment based on merit and preferences. Seat acceptance and joining mandatory to continue.
For candidates who didn't get a seat in round 1 or want upgradation. Fresh registrations needed.
Also called Round 3, for vacant seats after rounds 1 and 2. Fresh registration and choice filling.
Final chance to fill leftover seats post mop-up round, typically conducted offline.

importantNotes: Candidates who join a seat can opt for 'upgradation' in subsequent rounds
Those who reject or do not participate may lose seat security deposit based on rules

steps.description: Registration on MCC portal (mcc.nic.in) for AIQ and Deemed institutions. State-level portals for state quota counselling. Payment of registration fee and security deposit according to category. Upload necessary certificates and documents.
Candidates fill and lock choices of colleges and courses in order of preference. Multiple choices allowed; lock before deadline. Choices can be modified before locking deadline.
Based on rank, category, quota, and choices. Allotment results declared on MCC or respective state counselling websites. Download provisional and final allotment letters.
Report physically to the allotted institute within specified timelines. Mandatory original document verification as per checklist. Pay admission fees and complete joining process.
Confirm seat acceptance by reporting and fee payment. Failure to report results in seat forfeiture. Candidates who accept seats can participate in further rounds for upgradation.

KeyCounsellingTipsForCandidates.title: Key Counselling Tips for Candidates
tips: Regularly check MCC and respective state counselling portals for notifications
Register and pay fees promptly for each counselling round
Carefully fill choices based on priorities and realistic admission chances
Verify documents in advance to avoid last-minute issues
Attend physical reporting on time; non-reporting leads to seat cancellations
Understand upgradation process and participate to improve seat allotment if desired
Keep multiple backup options for choices
Use MCC helpline and notifications for any support or clarifications

DistinctionBetweenAllIndiaQuotaAndStateQ.title: Distinction Between All India Quota and State Quota Counselling

distinctions.allIndiaQuota: All Indian candidates irrespective of domicile (except specific state limits)
distinctions.stateQuota: Only candidates satisfying state domicile/residency criteria
Conducted separately by each state portal

distinctions.allIndiaQuota: Central, Deemed, AFMC, ESIC, AIIMS, JIPMER
distinctions.stateQuota: Government and Private medical colleges within state

activities: Result declaration and rank card release
Counselling notification by MCC and state authorities
Registration begins for AIQ and state quota counselling

states.specialFeatures: Separate counselling for government and private colleges, domicile certificate required
Online counselling with multiple rounds, rural quota available
7.5% horizontal reservation for government school students

states.conductingAuthority: Directorate of Medical Education and Training (DMET)
states.specialFeatures: Separate counselling for government and private medical colleges

states.conductingAuthority: West Bengal Joint Entrance Examinations Board (WBJEEB)
states.specialFeatures: Online counselling with document verification at designated centers

tips: Research college cutoffs from previous years
Keep 20-30% buffer in your rank for realistic choices
Fill maximum number of choices (up to 200)
Prioritize colleges based on your preferences and realistic chances
Include both government and private colleges for better options
Get all documents attested by gazetted officers
Keep multiple copies of each document
Verify document formats as per counselling authority requirements
Prepare domicile certificate well in advance
Get category certificates from appropriate authorities
Report to allotted college within stipulated time
Carry all original documents for verification
Pay admission fees immediately to confirm seat
Keep receipt of fee payment safely
Understand upgradation process for subsequent rounds
Calculate total cost including tuition, hostel, and other fees
Explore education loan options if needed
Check scholarship opportunities
Plan for multiple rounds of counselling fees
Keep emergency funds for unexpected expenses

mistakes.prevention: Set reminders and register on the first day
Prepare all documents well in advance

mistakes.consequence: Getting undesired college or no seat
mistakes.prevention: Research thoroughly and fill maximum choices
Research complete fee structure before choice filling

CounsellingHelplineAndSupport.title: Counselling Helpline and Support
onlineResources: Official college websites for specific information
Education ministry websites for policy updates

steps.description: Accept the allotted seat by paying the required fees within the stipulated time. This confirms your admission to the college.
Submit all required original documents to the college for verification. Keep attested copies for your records.
Undergo medical examination as required by the college. Some colleges may have specific health requirements.
Apply for hostel accommodation if needed. Check availability and application procedures with the college administration.
Attend orientation programs and begin your medical education journey. Familiarize yourself with college rules and regulations.
